availableBadges.description: For your dedication and a great Personal Development Plan progress.

successCriteria.successCriteria: Use VSTS REST API for automatization for TRI-LEDS and HOFF-DEFB projects
Use DSC for Thomson Reuters TRI-LEDS project
Use Pester to proceed with TDD of Azure based module for TRI-LEDS project

feedbacks.feedback:
I've used powershell scripts and VSTS REST API as build/release steps for checking latest build status, calculating code diff for TFVC, version calculation etc.
I use powershell in my regular activities like manage Azure files or analyze IIS logs.
For TRI-LEDS project I've written a custom DSC part for the deployment of a monitoring agent (updatable windows service).
Also, I had a very interesting and specific experience: I really used TDD and Pester to write a powershell module for Azure tags management.
Aliaksandra successfully applied REST API based approach within CI process and maintenance tasks in Azure DevOps at the HOFF-DEFB project.

successCriteria.successCriteria: Knowledge of branching models
Be able to consult beginners on Git functionality
Completed migration from SVN to Git for Thomson Reuters MULTAPI project

feedbacks.feedback:
In my current project I've elaborated on choosing branching strategy and had an interesting case with versioning of backend components/nuget packages.
I've migrated a big SVN project into several git repos with submodules.
I've passed and can definitely recommend an EPAM Git Bootcamp course from Iurii Bura.
I've consulted guys with Ops background on VCS in general and Git in practice.

I worked with Aliaksandra on the Thomson Reuters project. During the project I needed to work with a version control system based on Git, but I had no such experience before. Aliaksandra proposed her help. She was able to explain to me the basic principles, utilities and approaches. It was useful for completing my tasks.

actionItems.name: Set up CI/CD pipeline from scratch in Azure DevOps for  project HOFF-DEFB

successCriteria.successCriteria: All EPAM developed deliverables are built in Azure DevOps
All EPAM developed deliverables are deployed with Azure DevOps releases
Get practical experience with Azure DevOps Pipelines and Artifacts

feedbacks.feedback:
I joined the HOFF-DEFB project at its very beginning when there was no CI/CD.
I've created Azure build pipelines for all the customer's code stored in Azure Repos and integrated some CI for the third-party code from gitlab.
The project has microservice architecture, so now we use tens of CI pipelines on a daily basis. 
With the project growth, I've introduced branch policies including mandatory reviewers and build policies for all the pull requests.
With the planned migration to kubernetes, we added building docker images.
From CD perspective we support releases to windows and kubernetes.

I can confirm that EPAM uses Hoffmann (client) tools for dev process and it is Azure Devops stack. Thus, Sasha as main Dev ops on the project had to learn the tools and use that dev ops stack on production.

Sasha does a great job to configure and maintain pipelines to let team deploy different versions of application to several environments with a one-click solution. And she does it in advance - pipeline for new branch or new environment is ready to be used before team need it - team don't need to wait and can start work with new branch / environment when needed.
I think this goal is completed.
feedbacks.role: QA Team Lead from HOFF-DEFB project

feedbacks.feedback:
In regards to the success criteria's, all done

CI/CD pipeline: we're still in a migration process that's why I would say 50% done.
feedbacks.role: Technical Project Owner from HOFF-DEFB project

feedbacks.feedback: Aliaksandra designed and implemented an initial Azure DevOps CI/CD setup at HOFF-DEFB project. She made both Build and Release flows, resolved the issues that had been arisen during Build/Release flows execution, was constantly implementing the enhancements for issue solving and speeding them up. She was a helping hand in a process of CI/CD flows re-work to embrace new Docker-based builds and releases.

actionItems.name: Create and configure a log monitoring system from scratch for project HOFF-DEFB

successCriteria.successCriteria: Setup ELK stack to a windows server
Collect logs of EPAM developed components from all the environments
Map logs from different environments to appropriate kibana dashboards
Set retention policy: delete all the log indices older than 30 days
Advice QA and dev team on Kibana usage

feedbacks.feedback:
I've set up the ELK stack at a Windows machine from scratch.
Logs are collected with filebeat, so I've created a config template to use for new environments.
With the project growth, I set custom retention policy for old logs removal.
Curator script for it is launched daily as a scheduled task.
Old logs are deleted from environments with a scheduled powershell script.

Also Sasha is main specialist\creator of approach on logging setup for our project and troubleshooting our  applications. for that purpose she's setup ELK stack for all environments which is of course very helpful for the project since we got a number of environments and quite a lot of applications + quite a lot of changes from dev ops\dev perspectives.

Sasha configured kibana to let team check logs from several environments (regular, like QA, DEV, STG, but also PROD located at client factories). Logs are available for all EPAM developed components and 3rd party components as well. As well, she proposed to clear logs after some period of time and it was properly communicated with team (to find out optimal amount of time to store logs).
Sasha always helps team in case of questions related to searching for specific info in logs using kibana.
Introducing of reviewing logs through Kiabana tool helps a lot for troubleshooting.
I think this goal is completed.
feedbacks.role: QA Team Lead from HOFF-DEFB project

actionItems.name: Develop trustful and informal relationships with customer

successCriteria.successCriteria: Get acquainted with customer
Go to business trips
Proceed with pilot customer installation on a real machinery manufacture

feedbacks.feedback:
In my current project, I've worked a lot in touch with the customer.
It helps to understand each other and speeds up resolving problems.
I participate in daily calls with customer reporting the DevOps status.
For different matters, we communicate through quick calls/slack channels/emails.
We communicate face-to-face during customer trips to Minsk and EPAM business trips to Germany.
As a team, we have earned the trust of the customer thanks to staying in touch.

Sasha is a great person. Very engaged and strict forward. She gives clear opinions which I really appreaciate. She makes great work under time preasure and makes a good job. Especially in combination with our rollout to our pilot customer she showed high performence even at non usal working times. I appreciate to have hear on board.
All done
feedbacks.role: Technical Project Owner from HOFF-DEFB project

successCriteria.successCriteria: Write custom TFS tasks for project TRI-LEDS
Manage self-hosted and Azure DevOps-hosted agents for project HOFF-DEFB
Enhance CD pipeline maintainability with variable groups and task groups
Use TFS/Azure DevOps REST API to enhance CI/CD flow

feedbacks.feedback:
I've created several custom tasks for TRI-LEDS project: 
- a task for automatic tagging Azure Resource groups (used for cost management) 
- 2 tasks for setting/getting Azure key vault secrets
- a task for getting values from a custom key storage
- a task for the deployment of a service fabric application
Also created a documented SDLC with self-written CI and CD steps for custom TFS tasks to enable other project teams writing their own custom tasks. 

For HOFF-DEFB project we've started with one self-hosted Windows build agent.
I've set up and maintained this agent. With the project growth, we migrated from self-hosted windows agent to Azure DevOps hosted Ubuntu agents. I"ve changed our pipelines to use only cross-platform compatible tasks in our CI definitions.

Starting from implementing custom CI/CD steps in TFS tasks, I'm using TFS/Azure DevOps REST API
- for grabbing code changes in TGVC since the previous build 
- for custom TFS tasks deployment
- for enforced check of latest build status before triggering a deployment
- for making builds not retained (necessary during removal of obsolete definitions)

Aliaksandra set up Windows-based self-hosted build agents for the CI process at  HOFF-DEFB project. She was also constantly making the required software improvements in order to eliminate builds' dependencies issues. She also implemented an approach with Deployment groups, which helped to simplify set-up and deployment to client's hardware-based environments. Implementing variable and task groups usage helped to speed-up a reproducing process for the new environments and CI/CD flows.

actionItems.name: Implement code quality checks in CI pipeline for project HOFF-DEFB

successCriteria.successCriteria: Integrate unit tests into CI pipeline for HOFF-DEFB
Calculate code coverage for tested components
Analyse the source code with SonarCloud

feedbacks.feedback:
I've implemented a PoC for of Sonar Cloud usage for the HOFF-DEFB project.
Sonar processed the UI part and one backend component for 2 months.
It proved that EPAM deliverables have good quality and helped to fix some minor bugs.

Currently the project is in direction to achieve Continuous Delivery approach at some point of time. So dev and qa automation doing a number of different unit tests (E2E, API, unit). And of course the tests\approach itself must be incorporated in build pipelines. And as usual, Sasha was the person to work with dev\qa\qa autom to support this tests runs: incorporate tests in appropriate pipelines, setup and maintain QA automation environment, setting up monitoring tools.

actionItems.name: Proceed with pilot customer installation on a real machinery manufacture

successCriteria.successCriteria: Pass the Azure fundamentals microsoft course
Get practical experience with Azure

feedbacks.feedback:
After passing the course I've systematized my knowledge of Azure.
For project needs I used Azure VMs, NSGs, key vaults, storage accounts, Azure databases PostgreSQL, Automation Accounts and ARM templates.

New paradigm of Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) usage and Azure-related resources usage in was adopted at the HOFF-DEFB project. Aliaksandra dived into into with a passion, which helped her to receive the basics of AKS, ACR, ALB, Azure Storage services.

actionItems.name: Review the labs from katacoda. Basic level.
[Theoretical part] Presentations and books (~60-80h)
actionItems.description:
The part consists of the following theoretical materials:

  • Presentation
  • Books
  • Video-courses

Some of the materials are free, while some are not.

For each point, I put some estimation (from my perspective and based on my experience). I highly recommend you to find some friends who also are going to pass the exam and prepare for it together.

P.S. Here you will find my story of the exam: https://www.yammer.com/epam.com/threads/370858760355840 (Russian version: https://www.instagram.com/p/B3jaJ6wHs7t/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link )

Also, you will find a link to the Oreilly book, how to save money (450$->32$) for Oreilly subscription you find here:

successCriteria.successCriteria: Please make sure that you understand the whole materials, and discuss it with your friends\mentor.

materials.author: Aliaksandra Yermalovich

successCriteria.successCriteria: One of the best books about k8s

actionItems.name: One presentation about k8s, a short version with some useful references.  (2-3h)
Flash cards to remember what you've learned

materials.activityName: The card based on Linux Academy cards + my own (password: vedmich)
materials.author: Aliaksandra Yermalovich

actionItems.name: Before exam
actionItems.description:
List of check before to start exam:

  1. Make sure that you 2+ time repeat practice from Udemy (links with practice).
  2. Charge you mobilephone and laptop, as my experience shows, you need to be prepared for everything
  3. You can use copy\paste as many line as you need.
  4. Make sure that you know how fast generate base manifests for deployments\pods etc.
  5. Read hadnbook (for example, if you need a water during the 3 hours you have to use only transparent dishes like a glass)
  6. Add to bookmarks the links (all of them allowed during the exam):
    • https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubectl/cheatsheet/
    • https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/
    • https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubectl/kubectl-commands
    • https://github.com/kubernetes

And good luck with your preparation and during the exam.

If you have some question about k8s please do not hesitate to ask it on our yammer group.

actionItems.name: [Theoretical part] Presentations and books (~60-80h)
actionItems.description:
PREREQUISITES FOR THE LEARNING PATH (~10-15$)

1) You need to buy the following course:https://www.udemy.com/course/certified-kubernetes-administrator-with-practice-tests/

Here you can find all the theories for the exam. Also, it contains a practical part crucial for good preparation. It would be accessible after buying the course via the link:

https://kodekloud.com/courses/enrolled/675080

The goal:

  • Fill in the gaps in the theory
  • Back theory up with labs

The practical part will be available only after you buy the CKA course on Udemy, highly recommend to use (in other cases the links from the practical part will not available for you).

Please be careful, the standard price of the course is around 10-15$

2) Optional, but useful - https://linuxacademy.com/cp/modules/view/id/327

3) Access to https://learning.oreilly.com

Tips:

The exam is fully covered by docs related to the version that will be on the exam. The docs change as new Kubernetes version releases, usually, it happens quarterly.

Take into account that you have around 3 months to get used to that docs. In my case, the docs have been updated and some of the materials have been taken off.

STUDY OFFICIAL COURSES [~2 MONTHS )

The part consists of the following theoretical materials:

  • Presentation
  • Books
  • Video-courses

Some of the materials are free, while some are not.

For each point, I put some estimation (from my perspective and based on my experience). I highly recommend you find some friends who also are going to pass the exam and prepare for it together.

P.S. Here you will find my story of the exam: https://www.yammer.com/epam.com/threads/370858760355840 (Russian version )

I think most of you read a lot of technical and (not only) literature, and sometimes the price of a book can reach 40$+. How to save you money? Subscription. One of the most popular resources is https://www.oreilly.com. But the price for a year's subscription is 450$, it is too expensive.

How to save money (450$ to 30$) for Oreilly subscription (for Belarus, Russia, Ukraine)

Instruction how to save you money:

  1. Go to https://www.acm.org/membership/special-member-rates-developing-countries (You can read on their site about ACM )
  2. Select a student subscription (cost 30$) (differents between subscriptions you can read here )
  3. Select your country and finish registration.
  4. Go to https://www.oreilly.com and use your own ACM account for login. (In the login field put your ACM account, for example, vedmich@acm.org)

positionRanking.description: At least 3 years of experience. Advanced level in primary skill, Intermediate+ level in other professional skills. Good in scripting/automation. Able to contribute in design and deploy of solution, in capacity planning. Able to setup monitoring, conduct performance audit and performance optimization. Ability to supervise and train another SE1-SE2 specialist. Experience in bug / development tracking systems. Expected to be able to follow and understand a definedAgile or ITIL process, train other team members, and contribute in process improvement. Understanding of concepts of software development cycle.
Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation; able to create design, technical and project documentation including high-quality documentation of his/her code and solutions.
Plays the Systems Engineer, Maintenance Engineer, Database Administrator role or roles of DB Architect, Database or Systems Consultant or Maintenance and leading team up to 5 engineers

Creates deliverables in good quality. Strong ownership and personal responsibility. Team player. Able to train and couch juniors. Expected to be self-managing, implement functionality without supervision and test his/her work thoroughly using test cases
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision.
